sources.snippet_or_excerpt: Date: Thu, Dec 18, 2025 | 04:50 AM GMT The broader cryptocurrency market has remained under pressure in recent weeks, struggling to regain...
Market reports linked the selloff to renewed fears that the BoJ will tighten monetary policy at its meeting this week, threatening the yen...
Bitcoin slid to the $85000 level on December 15, extending its recent decline as global macro risks, leverage unwinding, and thin liquidity...
Crypto may face major volatility as the US job market weakens, pushing the Fed toward a pivotal December policy shift.
Bitcoin prices pushed lower on Thursday, November 20, extending recent losses as macro variables fueled weakness in the markets.

hypothesis_content.title: Asymmetric Amplification: Negative vs Positive Catalysts in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regimes, negative catalysts produce significantly larger absolute 4-hour price moves (amplification ratio > 1.5x) compared to positive catalysts of similar initial magnitude and sentiment score, due to stronger risk-off behavior vs. cautious optimism.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Market psychology in neutral conditions exhibits 'fear > greed' asymmetry. Negative news triggers immediate de-risking, while positive news meets skepticism and profit-taking. Current news flow (multiple negative BTC articles) supports this bias.
entry_conditions: Enter short if negative catalyst (sentiment < -0.7), long if positive (sentiment > 0.7)

exit_conditions.take_profit: For shorts: price reaches -1.5x to -2.0x initial move. For longs: price reaches +1.2x to +1.5x initial move (asymmetric targets)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses beyond 0.5x the initial move in opposite direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Statistical test shows median 4-hour amplification ratios for negative vs. positive catalysts are not significantly different (p > 0.05) in NEUTRAL regimes over 50+ events.
